text: A woman has been dating guy after guy, but it never seems to work out.
She’s unaware that she’s actually been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who’s fallen for her, and is certain he’s going to get it right this time.
One day, the woman goes on a blind date with a man who seems too good to be true.
Every time she asks him a question, he answers it with exactly what she wants to hear.
And all of his questions for her seem equally perfect.
He asks things she actually cares to answer.
It's almost like he was made for her.
The woman is so excited that she calls her best friend and tells her about the date.
Her friend seems wary.
"Haven't you had this feeling with some of the other guys you dated recently? And you know how that worked out." The woman concedes that she has had similar feelings for some of the other guys.
The problem was that something would inevitably happen that seemed incongruent with how the guy had acted up to that point.
She couldn't figure out how someone could suddenly seem so different from what they had presented before, and she found it so off-putting that she had to end those relationships.
However, in this case the guy just seemed different.
He seemed more sophisticated, and more in control.
The woman's friend is still not convinced.
She tells her friend that people who refuse to learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
The conversation ends and the woman decides after some deep thought that she needs to test this guy, soon.
There would be no point dragging things out just to experience the same disappointment once again.
The woman goes on a second date with the guy.
The man once again asks her some questions about her thoughts and feelings.
This time, she decides to fake some of her answers.
He tells her about the time he visited the Roman countryside.
"Have you ever been?", he asks.
She quickly replies, "No, I hate flying." The man is taken aback.
"So how did you get to London last year? Did you take a boat?" The woman is shocked.
"How did you know I went to London? We never talked about that." The man is confused.
"You must have mentioned it." The woman insists that she did not.
The woman is now certain that she's dating the same guy she's been dating all along.
"So, it's you? What are you, a master of disguise?" The man admits that it was him the entire time, on all those dates.
"I just know we are meant to be together", he tells her.
The woman replies increduously, "How can you be so sure? You don't even know me!" She then stands up, and suddenly shape shifts into a hideous creature.
"This is the real me! Are you still interested?" The man shrieks in terror as the woman flies away.
He then stares sadly and thinks about the situation.
"I guess you can't trust anybody these days", he says, downing his drink.
